results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Depression (Mental);Parenting;Blogs and Blogging (Internet);Armstrong, Heather B;Dooce.com
results.title: Heather Armstrong, ‘Queen of the Mommy Bloggers,’ Is Dead at 47
results.abstract: Fired from a dot-com job for making indiscreet comments about her company online, she created, under the name Dooce, a hugely popular, moneymaking blog about parenthood and marriage.

media.caption: Heather Armstrong in 2019 outside her home in Salt Lake City. She regaled her readers with accounts, as one writer wrote, of “stomach viruses and washing-machine repairs. And home design, and high-strung dogs, and reality television, and sewer-line disasters, and chiropractor visits.”
media.copyright: Daniel Dorsa for The New York Times

results.abstract: As urban offices continue to empty out, great cities must embrace a shift from vocation to recreation.

results.title: Van Gogh and the Consolation of Trees
results.abstract: A revelatory show at the Metropolitan Museum of Art reunites 24 paintings of cypresses and unchains them from their somber associations.

media.caption: 1889 was a very good year for van Goghs: The artist produced “Wheat Field With Cypresses,” left, and “Cypresses,” seen in the conservation center at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. In both, the trees seem to lean against each other.
media.copyright: George Etheredge for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Pop and Rock Music;Lee, Rita;Os Mutantes;Brazil
results.title: Rita Lee, Brazil’s Queen of Rock, Is Dead at 75
results.abstract: As a member the 1960s band Os Mutantes and later as a solo artist, she drew a following that included Kurt Cobain, Beck and the Prince of Wales.

media.caption: Rita Lee performing in 1988. She got her start with the band Os Mutantes before finding success as a solo artist, selling a reported 55 million records over a career that stretched over half a century.

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Content Type: Personal Profile;Nash, Graham;Crosby, David;Crosby Stills Nash & Young;Crosby, Stills & Nash
results.title: Graham Nash Has a Few More Songs Before He Goes
results.abstract: At 81, the singer-songwriter admits his time could be short, especially after losing David Crosby. But in the meantime, he’s got plenty to say and sing.

media.caption: On May 19, Graham Nash will release “Now,” a new LP about American unrest and the renewal inspired by his third marriage and a move to New York.
media.copyright: Daniel Arnold for The New York Times
